assertions.title: Strong authentication is required for admin interfaces
assertions.rationale: Strong authentication for admin interfaces prevents unauthorized access to web server management functions.

assertions.title: Service accounts are properly rotated and scoped
assertions.rationale: Proper service account management reduces the risk of credential compromise and limits potential damage.

assertions.title: Session timeout policies are configured for idle and absolute timeouts
assertions.rationale: Session timeouts prevent unauthorized access from abandoned sessions and reduce attack surface.

assertions.title: Account lockout policies protect against brute force attacks
assertions.rationale: Account lockout policies prevent brute force attacks and protect against credential stuffing.

assertions.title: Multi-factor authentication is required for administrative access
assertions.rationale: MFA for admin access significantly reduces the risk of unauthorized administrative access.

assertions.title: Admin roles are restricted to least privilege principles
assertions.rationale: Least privilege admin roles minimize potential damage from compromised administrative accounts.

assertions.title: File system permissions are hardened for web roots and sensitive directories
assertions.rationale: Hardened file system permissions prevent unauthorized access to web content and configuration files.

assertions.title: Reverse proxy access controls enforce route-level and header-based restrictions
assertions.rationale: Reverse proxy access controls prevent unauthorized access to backend services and sensitive routes.

assertions.title: TLS minimum version policy enforces TLS 1.2+ and disables weak ciphers
assertions.rationale: Strong TLS configuration prevents man-in-the-middle attacks and ensures secure data transmission.

assertions.title: HTTP Strict Transport Security (HSTS) is enforced with secure parameters
assertions.rationale: HSTS prevents protocol downgrade attacks and ensures HTTPS-only communication.

assertions.title: Certificate management includes automated issuance, renewal, and revocation
assertions.rationale: Automated certificate management prevents service outages due to expired certificates.

assertions.title: Cookie security flags are set appropriately (Secure, HttpOnly, SameSite)
assertions.rationale: Proper cookie security flags prevent XSS attacks and session hijacking.

assertions.title: Rate limiting and throttling protect endpoints from abuse and DoS
assertions.rationale: Rate limiting prevents DoS attacks and ensures fair resource usage.

assertions.title: DDoS mitigation is integrated with upstream WAF/CDN protections
assertions.rationale: DDoS mitigation integration provides layered protection against volumetric attacks.

assertions.title: Web server binds only to required interfaces and ports
assertions.rationale: Minimal listen surface reduces attack surface and prevents unauthorized access.

assertions.title: Access logs include sufficient fields for forensic analysis and analytics
assertions.rationale: Comprehensive access logging enables security monitoring and incident response.

assertions.title: Error log monitoring alerts on critical errors
assertions.rationale: Error log monitoring enables proactive detection of security issues and system problems.

assertions.title: Security events are logged for authentication, admin actions, and config changes
assertions.rationale: Security event logging provides audit trail for compliance and incident investigation.

assertions.title: Logs are reliably forwarded to SIEM systems
assertions.rationale: SIEM forwarding enables centralized security monitoring and correlation analysis.

assertions.title: Default and test sites are removed from production web servers
assertions.rationale: Removing default sites eliminates common attack vectors and information disclosure risks.

assertions.title: Unused modules, handlers, and filters are disabled
assertions.rationale: Disabling unused modules reduces attack surface and system complexity.

assertions.title: Directory listing and autoindex are disabled where not needed
assertions.rationale: Disabling directory listing prevents information disclosure and unauthorized file access.

assertions.title: Web server configurations, keys, and certificates are backed up
assertions.rationale: Configuration backups enable rapid recovery from system failures and attacks.

assertions.title: Web server and module patches are applied promptly
assertions.rationale: Timely patching prevents exploitation of known vulnerabilities in web server software.

assertions.title: Worker process limits prevent resource exhaustion and runaway processes
assertions.rationale: Worker process limits prevent DoS attacks and ensure system stability.

assertions.title: Health checks monitor endpoint and upstream health
assertions.rationale: Health checks enable proactive monitoring and automatic failover for high availability.

assertions.title: PII is redacted from logs to protect sensitive data
assertions.rationale: PII redaction in logs ensures compliance with privacy regulations and prevents data exposure.

assertions.title: Privacy and security headers are set appropriately
assertions.rationale: Privacy headers prevent information leakage and enhance security posture.

assertions.title: Virtual host isolation prevents cross-tenant access and resource sharing
assertions.rationale: Virtual host isolation ensures tenant data separation and prevents cross-tenant attacks.

assertions.title: Per-tenant rate limits are enforced to prevent abuse
assertions.rationale: Per-tenant rate limiting ensures fair resource usage and prevents tenant abuse.

assertions.title: Tenant logs are segregated with proper access controls
assertions.rationale: Tenant log segregation ensures data privacy and compliance with multi-tenant requirements.

assertions.title: Web Application Firewall (WAF) is integrated with proper rule configuration
assertions.rationale: WAF integration provides application-layer protection against common web attacks.

assertions.title: Content Security Policy (CSP) is enforced to prevent XSS attacks
assertions.rationale: CSP prevents cross-site scripting attacks and unauthorized resource execution.

assertions.title: Input validation and sanitization are enforced for all user inputs
assertions.rationale: Input validation prevents injection attacks and ensures data integrity.

assertions.title: Session management implements secure session handling and protection
assertions.rationale: Secure session management prevents session hijacking and fixation attacks.

assertions.title: API endpoints implement proper authentication and authorization
assertions.rationale: API endpoint security prevents unauthorized access and abuse of application interfaces.

assertions.title: SSL/TLS configuration uses strong cipher suites and protocols
assertions.rationale: Strong SSL/TLS configuration ensures secure data transmission and prevents protocol attacks.

assertions.title: Error handling displays secure error pages without information disclosure
assertions.rationale: Secure error handling prevents information disclosure and system fingerprinting.

assertions.title: File upload security includes validation, scanning, and execution prevention
assertions.rationale: File upload security prevents malicious file uploads and execution of unauthorized code.

assertions.title: XSS prevention includes proper output encoding and input filtering
assertions.rationale: XSS prevention protects users from cross-site scripting attacks and data theft.
